intro: Anatherostipa brevis, commonly known as the short-stemmed grass, is a species of grass belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of many grass species. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. Anatherostipa brevis is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions with its drought-resistant features.
